intro: Pusaetha stuhlmannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and clustered foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Pusaetha stuhlmannii thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
